sen.j: 北条時益（ほうじょう ときます、？ - 元弘3年/正慶2年5月8日 (旧暦)（1333年6月19日））は、鎌倉幕府最後の六波羅探題（南方）である。
sen.e: Tokimasu HOJO (date of birth unknown, died May 8, 1333 (old lunar calendar) (June 19, 1333)) was the last Rokuhara Tandai (an administrative and judicial agency in Rokuhara, Kyoto) (Minamikata) (South) of the Kamakura bakufu.

Tokimasu HOJO (date of birth unknown, died June 28, 1333) was the last Rokuhara Tandai (an administrative and judicial agent in Rokuhara, Kyoto) (Minamikata) (South) of the Kamakura bakufu (Japanese feudal government headed by a shogun).
sen.cmt: 幕府の説明補足旧暦削除June 19→June 28に変更しました。

sen.j: 1331年（元弘元年）の元弘の変で、六波羅探題北方の北条仲時とともに、挙兵した。
sen.e: In the Genko Rebellion in 1331, he took up arms with Nakatoki HOJO, who was serving as Rokuhara Tandai Kitakata (North).

sen.j: 笠置山（京都府相楽郡笠置町）に籠城した後醍醐天皇と楠木正成らを攻め、激戦の末に天皇を隠岐島に配流する。
sen.e: They attacked Emperor Godaigo and Masashige KUSUNOKI, who cloistered themselves in Mt. Kasagi (Kasagi Town, Soraku Country, Kyoto Prefecture), and exiled them to Oki no shima Island after a fierce battle.

sen.j: 1333年（元弘3年/正慶2年）、後醍醐の綸旨を受けて挙兵に応じた足利尊氏（高氏）に六波羅を攻められた。
sen.e: In 1333, Rokuhara was attacked by Takauji ASHIKAGA (the Ko clan), who took up arms at Emperor Godaigo's command.

sen.j: 仲時とともに、光厳天皇や花園天皇を伴って東国へ落ち延びようとした。
sen.e: He tried to escape to Togoku (the eastern part of Japan, particularly Kanto region) with Nakatoki, Emperor Kogon and Emperor Hanazono.

sen.e: However, he was attacked by a nobushi (unofficial warrior hidden in a forest) in Omi Province (Shiga Prefecture) on his way, and died in the battle.
